ygData.subject: Re: Price Fixing
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hell no.  I don t agree with fixing, and I sure as hell don t agree with anyone being told ever to sell at any price.  If they feel like taking a loss,
ygData.messageBody:
At 17:36 5/19/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: "John Cuyle" <johncuyle@...>
>
>Prices on banded should be at least as much as chain. Smiths who sell lower
>than that are doing a terrible disservice to their fellow smiths. All
>Verant needs to do to fix this problem is make merchants pay a reasonable
>amount for smithed goods, then we wouldn't see stupid things like people
>selling at or below cost.

Hell no. I don't agree with fixing, and I sure as hell don't agree with
anyone being told ever to sell at any price. If they feel like taking a
loss, they can role-play it like they're helping the general good of the
populace or whatever they feel like, because it is, after all, their money
and their items.

That aside, I agree 100% that the shops should pay more for hand-made
items. If not that they're "special". then that they're as good as the
ones you can buy in the shops, and should at least re-sell at 75% of the
price you'd get for their equivalant item.
